Title: "What Dante Missed," The Vice Bondage of a Great City, 1912
Descriptive Text: Robert Harland's The Vice Bondage of a Great City (1912) typified early twentieth-century portrayals of Chicago as riddled with vice. The book's refrain, "Chicago is the Wickedest City in the World," punctuates references to the specific temptations that await the innocent visitor.
